description: Starts the virtual interface failover test that verifies your configuration meets your resiliency requirements by placing the BGP peering session in the DOWN state. You can then send traffic to verify that there are no outages. You can run the test on public, private, transit, and hosted virtual interfaces. You can use ListVirtualInterfaceTestHistory to view the virtual interface test history. If you need to stop the test before the test interval completes, use StopBgpFailoverTest.

parameters.name: virtualInterfaceId
parameters.description: The ID of the virtual interface you want to test.

parameters.name: bgpPeers
parameters.description: The BGP peers to place in the DOWN state. (string) ---

parameters.name: testDurationInMinutes
parameters.description: The time in minutes that the virtual interface failover test will last. Maximum value: 4,320 minutes (72 hours). Default: 180 minutes (3 hours).

nested_items.name: virtualInterfaceTest
nested_items.description: Information about the virtual interface failover test.

nested_items.name: testId
nested_items.description: The ID of the virtual interface failover test.

nested_items.name: virtualInterfaceId
nested_items.description: The ID of the tested virtual interface.

nested_items.name: bgpPeers
nested_items.description: The BGP peers that were put in the DOWN state as part of the virtual interface failover test.

nested_items.name: status
nested_items.description: The status of the virtual interface failover test.

nested_items.name: ownerAccount
nested_items.description: The owner ID of the tested virtual interface.

nested_items.name: testDurationInMinutes
nested_items.description: The time that the virtual interface failover test ran in minutes.

nested_items.name: startTime
nested_items.description: The time that the virtual interface moves to the DOWN state.

nested_items.name: endTime
nested_items.description: The time that the virtual interface moves out of the DOWN state.
